Oxycodone

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Oxycodone Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? NO Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? Sometimes Possible to Test for? YES Detection Period in Urine 3-4 days

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears within the Erowid website, following sections on library resources and site information, and marks the beginning of the Oxycodone page within the Pharmaceuticals Vault. It introduces detailed information about drug testing for oxycodone, including detection in urine tests and relevant disclaimers.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Oxycodone and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Oxycodone and drug tests.
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing

Most basic drug urine tests that test for "opiates" detect morphine, which both heroin and codeine break down into. Morphine is not a major metabolite of oxycodone, so these standard opiate tests generally do not succesfully detect low to moderate oxycodone use. However, several inexpensive urine drug tests are currently available that also test for oxycodone, with a detection cutoff of 100 ng/mL. Oxycodone is also detectable by more expensive (and more rare) GC/MS and HPLC laboratoray testing. High dose or frequent recent use of oxycodone may leave enough morphine in the body to be detected even by basic tests. In Dec 2004, we received email from someone who tested positive for opiate use, on a standard urine drug screen, after snorting 15-50 mg of oxycodone most days for the 3 weeks before a test.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This section details the types of drug tests used to detect oxycodone, explaining the limitations of standard opiate urine tests, the availability of specific oxycodone screening methods, thresholds for detection, laboratory testing options, and anecdotal evidence of detection in frequent users. It follows the U.S. drug testing summary for oxycodone and precedes the caution and disclaimer section.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Oxycodone and drug tests.

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Oxycodone and drug tests.
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears at the end of Erowid's "Oxycodone Drug Testing" page, following information on how standard and extended urine drug tests detect oxycodone. It provides a disclaimer about the variability of drug detection periods, outlines the limitations of drug testing data, and lists related resources and external links for further information on oxycodone and drug testing.
